TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit SeekToConditionItemView extends Microsoft.Exchange.WebServices.Data.ViewBase
Public NotInheritable Class SeekToConditionItemView Inherits ViewBase

Docs.summary: Represents the view settings in a folder search operation. The class is applicable for clients that target Exchange Online and versions of Exchange starting with Exchange Server 2013.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(class Microsoft.Exchange.WebServices.Data.SearchFilter condition, int32 pageSize) cil managed
Public Sub New (condition As SearchFilter, pageSize As Integer)

Docs.param: The condition to be used when seeking.
The maximum number of elements the search operation should return.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with a search filter and a page size. The constructor is applicable for clients that target Exchange Online and versions of Exchange starting with Exchange Server 2013.

MemberSignature.Value: public SeekToConditionItemView (Microsoft.Exchange.WebServices.Data.SearchFilter condition, int pageSize, Microsoft.Exchange.WebServices.Data.OffsetBasePoint offsetBasePoint);

.method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(class Microsoft.Exchange.WebServices.Data.SearchFilter condition, int32 pageSize, valuetype Microsoft.Exchange.WebServices.Data.OffsetBasePoint offsetBasePoint) cil managed

Docs.param: The condition to be used when seeking.
The maximum number of elements the search operation should return.
The position in the item view from which to measure the offset.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with a search filter, a page size, and a base point for the offset. The constructor is applicable for clients that target Exchange Online and versions of Exchange starting with Exchange Server 2013.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property Microsoft::Exchange::WebServices::Data::SearchFilter ^ Condition { Microsoft::Exchange::WebServices::Data::SearchFilter ^ get(); void set(Microsoft::Exchange::WebServices::Data::SearchFilter ^ value); };

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the search filter for seek. The property is applicable for clients that target Exchange Online and versions of Exchange starting with Exchange Server 2013.

remarks.para: The available search filter classes include SearchFilter.IsEqualTo, SearchFilter.ContainsSubstring, and SearchFilter.SearchFilterCollection. If SearchFilter is a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic), no search filters are applied.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property Microsoft::Exchange::WebServices::Data::OffsetBasePoint OffsetBasePoint { Microsoft::Exchange::WebServices::Data::OffsetBasePoint get(); void set(Microsoft::Exchange::WebServices::Data::OffsetBasePoint value); };

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the position in an item view from which to measure an offset. The base point is at either the beginning or the end of an item view. The property is applicable for clients that target Exchange Online and versions of Exchange starting with Exchange Server 2013.
Docs.value: The base point of the offset.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property OrderBy As OrderByCollection

Docs.summary: Gets the properties against which the returned items should be ordered. The property is applicable for clients that target Exchange Online and versions of Exchange starting with Exchange Server 2013.
Docs.value: The properties against which the returned items should be ordered.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property int PageSize { int get(); void set(int value); };

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the maximum number of items or folders the search operation should return. The property is applicable for clients that target Exchange Online and versions of Exchange starting with Exchange Server 2013.
Docs.value: The maximum number of items or folders the search operation should return.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property Microsoft::Exchange::WebServices::Data::ItemTraversal Traversal { Microsoft::Exchange::WebServices::Data::ItemTraversal get(); void set(Microsoft::Exchange::WebServices::Data::ItemTraversal value); };

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the mode of the search traversal. Defaults to . The property is applicable for clients that target Exchange Online and versions of Exchange starting with Exchange Server 2013.
